channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Millennial CEO reveals ‘the most honest’ time-off request from his Gen Z employee: ‘I just had a breakup… I need a short break’
item.description: The boss approved the request without question, but concluded: “Gen Z doesn’t do filters!”

item.title: How Wearable Tech Could Become ‘Big Brother’ in the Workplace
item.description: Monitoring people’s data from popular fitness gadgets can easily cross many privacy and ethical boundaries, risking a backlash from your workforce.

item.title: Zillow Made a Real-Estate App for ChatGPT in 6 Weeks. Here’s How
item.description: Zillow is the first real-estate app on ChatGPT, giving the company a new way to reach customers.

item.title: Bank of America prioritizes bigger AI initiatives, as annual spending on new tech increased by 44% over the past decade
item.description: Hari Gopalkrishnan, the chief technology and information officer for Bank of America, is responsible for the $4 billion spent this year on AI and othe...

item.title: Supreme Court justices appear skeptical of Trump’s tariffs
item.description: Key Supreme Court conservatives seemed skeptical Wednesday that President Donald Trump has the power to unilaterally impose far-reaching tariffs , pot...

item.title: McDonald’s is losing its lowest-income customers — and it’s not hard to see why
item.description: The results are in. McDonald’s latest earnings report sheds light on the growing divide among U.S. consumers —as the wealthiest Americans continue to ...

item.title: McDonald’s and Cava’s earnings have one thing in common: The K-shaped economy has a vice grip on the lunchtime crowd
item.description: The restaurant chains’ CEOs noted that while young, lower-income consumers are pulling back, high-income earners are still hungry to spend.

item.title: Inflation is so bad Americans are counting on Black Friday just to afford groceries and everyday essentials
item.description: "Black Friday is still a make-or-break moment for retailers, but shopper behavior is shifting," says Lightspeed Commerce founder and CEO Dax Dasilva.

item.title: Postings for this AI job are up 800%
item.description: Many big companies have cited AI as a reason for recent layoffs. But the new technology transforming the workforce may create some new jobs, too. AI s...

item.title: These Channels Are Blocked During the Disney-YouTube TV Fight
item.description: Streaming viewers are caught in the middle of a contract battle that will feel very familiar to anyone who remembers linear TV.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani’s signature housing policy is widely loathed by economists. Here’s why
item.description: Economists argue rent freezes benefit insiders at the expense of outsiders.

item.title: Trump focuses on affordability after Democrats secure major election wins
item.description: Democrats dominated the first major Election Day since President Donald Trump returned to the White House. And while a debate about the future of the ...

item.title: The internet mourns Teen Vogue, a magazine brand that ‘took young people seriously’
item.description: On November 3, Vogue announced that it is folding its sister publication Teen Vogue into Vogue.com. Now, the internet is mourning the loss of a rare p...

item.title: 5 Takeaways for Business Owners from Tuesday’s Blue Wave Election Results
item.description: Elections in New York City, New Jersey, Virginia, and California offered some valuable lessons for entrepreneurs.

item.title: How AI Training Can Lead to Productivity Gains
item.description: Workplaces that tell employees to use AI, and follow through with training and support get twice as much out of these tools.
